DataElement.preferredName: Head and Neck Cutaneous Squamous Cell Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Clinical Regional Lymph Node N Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for head and neck cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma based on information obtained from the date of cancer diagnosis until the start of definitive treatment, or within four months (whichever is shorter), using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Head and Neck Tumor Clinical N Stage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the clinical N stage of a head and neck tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: For oncology, area of the body generally construed to comprise base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: For oncology, an area of the body generally construed to comprise the base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 6/29/21 TL Changed RS to Qualified. 6/23/21 TL received permission from Brian Campbell to transfer ownership from CTEP to NCI Standards; AK.   Updated to use Property based on NCIt concept

ValueDomain.preferredName: Head and Neck Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 Clinical N Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cNX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cNX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck in which the regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed.  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cNX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck in which the regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed.  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cN3b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cN3b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastasis in any lymph node(s) and ENE(+). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cN3b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastasis in any lymph node(s) and ENE(+). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cN3a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cN3a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastasis in a lymph node larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cN3a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastasis in a lymph node larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cN3 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cN3 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastasis in a lymph node larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-); or metastasis in any lymph node(s) and clinically overt ENE(+). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cN3 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastasis in a lymph node larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-); or metastasis in any lymph node(s) and clinically overt ENE(+). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cN2c TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cN2c TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastases in bilateral or contralateral lymph nodes, none larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-).  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cN2c TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastases in bilateral or contralateral lymph nodes, none larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-).  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cN2b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cN2b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastases in multiple ipsilateral lymph nodes, none larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-).  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cN2b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastases in multiple ipsilateral lymph nodes, none larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-).  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cN2a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cN2a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node larger than 3 cm but not larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cN2a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node larger than 3 cm but not larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cN2 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cN2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node larger than 3 cm but not larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-); or metastases in multiple ipsilateral lymph nodes, none larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-); or metastases in bilateral or contralateral lymph nodes, none larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-).  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cN2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node larger than 3 cm but not larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-); or metastases in multiple ipsilateral lymph nodes, none larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-); or metastases in bilateral or contralateral lymph nodes, none larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-).  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cN1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cN1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node, 3 cm or smaller in greatest dimension and ENE(-).  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cN1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node, 3 cm or smaller in greatest dimension and ENE(-).  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cN0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cN0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck without metastasis in the regional lymph nodes.  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck cN0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck without metastasis in the regional lymph nodes.  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.
